meanings.definition: The act of dividing something into two parts.
meanings.sent1: The bipartition of the cake made it easy to share.
meanings.sent2: The bipartition of the country led to two separate nations.
meanings.sent3: The bipartition of the sandwich caused a playful argument over who got the bigger half.
meanings.sent4: The bipartition of the team into two groups created a sense of competition.
meanings.sent5: The clear bipartition of the road into two lanes helped traffic flow smoothly.

meanings.sent1: The bipartition of the book into chapters made it easier to read.
meanings.sent2: The bipartition of the company resulted in two smaller firms.
meanings.sent3: The bipartition of the pizza caused confusion over which half had more toppings.
meanings.sent4: The bipartition of the garden into two sections created a sense of balance.
meanings.sent5: The sudden bipartition of the sky by a lightning bolt startled everyone.
